results.title: The Thompsons: migrating to the city
results.creator_credit: Meg Stewart, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of a family who have moved from a small country town to Sydney for the benefit of their children. Discusses some of the problems and differences they encounter. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Sue and Mario: the Italian Australians
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
An introduction to the hybrid lifestyles resulting from the marriage of two second-generation Australians of different ethnic origins. Both Sue and Mario are second generation Australians. Sue’s family migrated from England, whilst Mario’s came from Italy. The couple live in Griffith, a N.S.W. rural community where more than fifty per cent of the population is of Italian descent. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Noyce, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.description:

results.title: Roslyn and Blagica: everybody needs a friend
results.creator_credit: Richard Mordaunt, James Ricketson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Discussion highlights a young Yugoslav girl’s desire to become Australian in order to gain acceptance and combat prejudice. By contrast, her Australian friend endorses the continuance of ethnic identity and customs and extols the virtues of a multicultural society.
results.title_for_label: Roslyn and Blagica: everybody needs a friend
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Mordaunt, James Ricketson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia

results.title: Minh: a Vietnamese
results.creator_credit: Nick Torrens, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A look at the life of a Vietnamese refugee in Australia. Minh talks about his life and hopes for his children in his new country.

results.title: Leong, Angela: a cultural transition
results.creator_credit: Tony Wheeler, Jan Sharp, Film Australia and R P Birch and Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Leong, a Malaysian born Chinese, and Angela, an Australian born Chinese, both talk about their attitudes towards being assimilated into Australian society.

results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A Greek child’s first day at school. Demonstrates the difficulties non-English speaking children and their parents have in their “new” country.

results.title: Flo and Marianna: a matter of language
results.creator_credit: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Depicts the plight of aged migrant people living alone. In Marianna’s case, Flo, the Australian next door - “takes her up”, showing her own attitudes towards migrants in the process. Credits include: Camera by Tony Wilson; sound by Rodney Simmons.
results.title_for_label: Flo and Marianna: a matter of language
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linda Blagg, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Depicts the plight of aged migrant people living alone. In Marianna’s case, Flo, the Australian next door - “takes her up”, showing her own attitudes towards migrants in the process. Credits include: Camera by Tony Wilson; sound by Rodney Simmons.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Depicts the plight of aged migrant people living alone. In Marianna’s case, Flo, the Australian next door - “takes her up”, showing her own attitudes towards migrants in the process. Credits include: Camera by Tony Wilson; sound by Rodney Simmons.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of the life style of an Australian family living in Woolgoolga, a small town on the New South Wales coast. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Curtis Levy, Jan Sharp and Film Australia

results.title: Caterina: an extended family
results.creator_credit: Gillian Leahy, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Italian-born Caterina works as a school teacher, while her parents-in-law look after the children. She and her husband Pepo discuss the advantages and disadvantages of living in this extended family arrangement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gillian Leahy, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.description:
